examples: [Ignatz, under the rain:] It's a good thing I had this tarp handy. [...] / [Officer Pupp:] Gimme that canvas, it's much more important that I keep dry.

verbs.description: tarp (third-person singular simple present tarps, present participle tarping, simple past and past participle tarped)

entries.meaning: To cover something with a tarpaulin.
examples: The load may be tarped for serious white water, but tarped or not, everything should be tied securely in case of capsize.
